column4: I'm getting a blank desktop after logging into gnome... signing out and trying to log in again.  I created a separate user, and everything works fine.  Any ideas where to look to troubleshoot?
mkquist... it works find for my new user... just when I try re-logging in with the old user
First off, you will probably want to afford the new user some more priviledges.  Edit /etc/group  (to give new user rights to more devices / services).
is there a quick command to assign my new user the same groups as my existing user?
Edit /etc/group and add the new user name to the end of each line that has old user name, (preceeded by ,  and no spaces).
k, I've added my new user to the same groups as my old user... still can log in/out and in again just fine...
Log out and back in again in order for the new user to realize new priviledges.
done... logged in and out twice
any other ideas for troublshooting this gnome login issue?
There are only 2 issues, username and password.  You are typing one of them in wrong.
un/pw isn't the issue, it works fine after reboot... but after logging out and back in is when it stops working
I'll see what I can figure out.  Thanks for the help
the desktop doesn't show up.  the panels, the icons, nothing
just a brown screen with a working mouse
is there any particular logs I should be looking for errors in?
You might try Alt-F2  and run  gnome-panel
